div.a: INSTRUCTIONAL RESOURCES FOR LEARNING AT HOME

p.b: RSU #71 will begin delivering go-bag meals via school buses on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays
p.span: , delivering 2 day's worth each day. The delivery service is for families who don't have transportation to our feeding sites. Bus drivers and school administrators will be working together to get make the drop-offs, while strictly observing social-distancing protocols. We will continue to be open for curbside pick up of go-bag meals at Ames Elementary, East Belfast Elementary and Captain Albert Stevens from 8:00 am - 12 noon on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

u.a: Click here to view the routes and approximate delivery times.

span.font: Please call your school principal if you

div.span: wish to be added to the delivery list
. If there are children in more than one school you need only call one principal:

p.span: BAHS and BCOPE: Jeff Lovejoy 322-1054 and Colden Golann 322-8099
THMS: Bruce Bailey 930-9720 and Alta Seekins 322-4744

li.a: Welcome to Your RSU #71 School Board Meeting and Public Participation Guidelines

br.span: Posted Mar 30, 2020, 7:11 AM by Christine Guerette

font.span: I hope this update finds you all well. The finches at the bird feeder are wearing bright yellow today, and the bluebells and crocuses are popping up in the yard. They are heartening reminders that spring is coming again.
In this week's update letter from me you can read about RSU #71's efforts at providing meals for our community and read information on the upcoming school vacation, remote learning, and other items.

div.span: Please visit the RSU #71 COVID-19 information pages by clicking the links above to see this latest update letter. We thank you for your patience and cooperation as we do our best to help our students and others in the community.

div.font: 41 Lions Way, PO Box 325, Belfast, ME 04915
We are dedicated to provide engaging learning opportunities that allow all students to grow and prosper
